nodes.label: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
Block of blue ice with arrow to puddle labeled 'ice melting'
Arrow from blue puddle back to block labeled 'freezing'
Brown and white raw egg with arrow to pan labeled 'egg cooking'
Arrow to cooked egg outside the pan labeled 'cooked egg'
Understands reversible changes with ice melting and freezing
Correctly represents reversible change of water to ice and vice versa
Cooks an egg but may imply it's reversible
Misunderstanding: Egg cooking is shown but might suggest reversibility
Clarify that cooked eggs do not revert to raw when cooled
Suggest clear labeling of irreversible changes
